---
title: Development of L2 metaphorical production
type: pub
encoding: UTF-8

---

De Gruyter Mouton. <a href="https://www.degruyter.com/viewbooktoc/product/512382">https://www.degruyter.com/viewbooktoc/product/512382</a></div> </div>

<div id="csl-bib-meta-SBMD3YD7" class="csl-bib-meta">
  <article id="about-article-SBMD3YD7" class="about_pub-article">
    <h1>Om</h1>
    Nacey utforskar rolla til metaforar i læring av eit andrespråk (L2) i denne boka. Dei framhevar at metaforar, som er språklege bilete der eit ord eller uttrykk blir brukt om eit objekt eller ei handling som det ikkje bokstaveleg høyrer til, ofte blir oversett i språkkurs. Boka er delt i to delar: den første delen drøftar kvifor metaforar er viktige for L2-lærarar og korleis dei kan lærast effektivt, medan den andre delen presenterer åtte studiar som viser praktiske døme og utfordringar ved å undervise metaforar i reelle L2-situasjonar. Denne forskinga er viktig fordi ho foreslår at integrering av metaforar i språkundervisning kan forbetre forståing og kommunikasjon for L2-lærarar.
  </article>
  <article id="keywords-article-SBMD3YD7" class="keywords-article">
    <h1>Emneord</h1>
    Metafor, L2-undervising, Lingvistisk motivasjon, Framandspråkslæring, Empiriske studiar
  </article>
  <article id="abstract-article-SBMD3YD7" class="abstract-article">
    <h1>Samandrag</h1>
    Exploring the role that metaphor plays in our linguistic and conceptual systems from a Cognitive Linguistics (CL)-oriented perspective has attracted a great deal of attention for the past three decades. The analysis of the applications of some theoretical tenets of CL (mainly the notion of linguistic motivation) has been particularly fruitful in foreign language (L2) instruction. However, despite some important research findings related to the presentation of word meanings as systematically connected, metaphor is still rarely included as an important part of language courses designed for L2 learners. This volume explores the important role of metaphor in L2 instruction by presenting both theoretical accounts and empirical studies into the topic. Part I comprises four theoretical chapters that touch upon issues of continuing relevance to the discipline (e.g. why metaphor is relevant for L2 learners and how it can be effectively taught) and introduce areas in need of further research (metaphor in L2 instruction in languages other than English or metaphor and young L2 learners). Part II consists of eight empirical studies that illustrate methodological challenges and best practices when analyzing metaphor in real L2 contexts.
  </article>
